channel.title: Kowarsky Ritson LLP
channel.description: Recent content on Kowarsky Ritson LLP

item.title: Migrate from Jekyll
item.description: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output. Hugo keeps all static content under static. You should therefore move it all there. With Jekyll, something that looked like ▾ <root>/ ▾ images/ logo.png should become ▾ <root>/ ▾ static/ ▾ images/ logo.png Additionally, you’ll want any files that should reside at the root (such as CNAME) to be moved to static.

item.title: Linked post
item.description: I’m a linked post in the menu. You can add other posts by adding the following line to the frontmatter: menu = "main" Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. item.title: Go is for lovers
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in go templates. This document is a brief primer on using go templates.

item.title: Hugo is for lovers
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Goto hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your os and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step. More complete instructions are available at installing hugo Step 2. Build the Docs Hugo has its own example site which happens to also be the documentation site you are reading right now. Follow the following steps: Clone the hugo repository Go into the repo Run hugo in server mode and build the docs Open your browser to http://localhost:1313 Corresponding pseudo commands:

item.title: Creating a new theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

item.title: Asaf Mallek
item.description: Asaf has a wide-ranging litigation practice and has appeared on behalf of his clients before the BC Court of Appeal, the BC Supreme Court, Bankruptcy Court, the BC Provincial Court, Workers’ Compensation Appeal Tribunal (WCAT), WorkSafeBC, and the BC Human Rights Tribunal. He has experience in a wide range of legal matters ranging from commercial litigation to family law to administrative and tribunal law. He received a Master of Laws with Commendation from City, University of London (2011), a Bachelor of Laws with Honours from Cardiff University (2009), and a Bachelor of Arts from University of British Columbia (2000).

item.title: Joselina Silva
item.description: Joselina is the Bookkeeper of Kowarsky Ritson LLP and has had over 20 years of experience in Accounting. In addition, she provides a supportive role in many aspects of organization and management of files, including correspondence with clients and related parties. Outside of work, her interests include travelling, reading, and spending time with her friends and family.

item.title: Lagrimas Tamayao
item.description: Lagrimas returned to Kowarsky Ritson LLP in 2017 as the Firm’s Receptionist. She is responsible for the day-to-day work of the front desk, and provides a wide range of administrative support, including preparation of Mortgage documents and communication with clients and related parties.

item.title: Ori J. Kowarsky
item.description: Ori has a wide-ranging litigation practice and has appeared on behalf of his clients before the BC Court of Appeal, the BC Supreme Court, the Federal Court of Canada, Bankruptcy Court, every level of Provincial Court, Worksafe/BC and the BC Human Rights Tribunal. He has over fourteen years’ experience in a wide range of legal matters ranging from commercial litigation to family law to administrative and tribunal law. Ori is also an award-winning filmmaker and his continuing work in that field informs his film, television and new media practice for local and international filmmakers and artists.

item.title: Pei Yi Yeh
item.description: Pei has a wide range of experience in legal matters from personal injury to creditors’ remedies and corporate law. She regularly appears in the BC Provincial Court and Supreme Court on behalf of her clients. Pei was called to the bar in 2018 after articling with Kowarsky Ritson LLP. She received an LLB from the University of Edinburgh, an M.Litt. in Philosophy from St. Andrews University, and a BA in Political Science from McGill University.

item.title: Richard W.H. Ritson
item.description: Legal assistant: Lagrimas Tamayao 604-683-6875 ext. 221 reception@kowarsky.ca Richard has been a trusted advisor to his clients for over 20 years, and a partner in the firm since 2002. He has a varied practice including wills, probate/estate administration, elder law, private business advising, and real estate, mortgage and collections/foreclosure work. He received a Bachelor of Laws from the University of Victoria (1988) and a Bachelor of Arts (Hons.) in History from the University of Western Ontario (1985).

item.title: Wills, Estate Planning, and Estate Administration
